results.content:
The Good,
- The instructor is educational and engaging in some points.
- The courses describe some of the most used AngularJs functionalities through easy to understand examples.

The Bad,
- The courses describe some of the least used AngularJs functionalities. Maybe you should have shown less directives/services but delve deeper into the selected ones.
- No concise explanation of dependency injection even though it's mentioned.
- Some examples do not demonstrate the proper usage of AngularJs. It would have been better if you would have shown one big example/project showcasing the strengths of AngularJs instead of smaller distinct ones.

The Ugly,

- Sorry to say this but the English accent is bad. I'm a foreign speaker too and I can understand the struggle, but since you make an English programming course make sure your verbal skills are up to the task.
- Using internal javascript in your html files is bad practice. Maybe it should have been better to separate your javascript from your html. Same goes for your css in some points during the course.
results.content_html:
The Good,
- The instructor is educational and engaging in some points.
- The courses describe some of the most used AngularJs functionalities through easy to understand examples.

The Bad,
- The courses describe some of the least used AngularJs functionalities. Maybe you should have shown less directives/services but delve deeper into the selected ones.
- No concise explanation of dependency injection even though it's mentioned.
- Some examples do not demonstrate the proper usage of AngularJs. It would have been better if you would have shown one big example/project showcasing the strengths of AngularJs instead of smaller distinct ones.

The Ugly,

- Sorry to say this but the English accent is bad. I'm a foreign speaker too and I can understand the struggle, but since you make an English programming course make sure your verbal skills are up to the task.
- Using internal javascript in your html files is bad practice. Maybe it should have been better to separate your javascript from your html. Same goes for your css in some points during the course.

results.content:
A Quick crash course on AngularJS (Angular1.4.1), This course is more about walk through over few directives, services and routing. Though a newbie would get to know a lot about the younger days of Angular.
About Author: He is focussed to what he wants to explain out of this course.

Pros: Someone looking to dive into some existing code in Angular 1.4,, this is course is a quick brush up.
Cons: Missed few things like Dependency Injection, In Integration with APIs,, which are mostly the real world scenarios.
results.content_html:
A Quick crash course on AngularJS (Angular1.4.1), This course is more about walk through over few directives, services and routing. Though a newbie would get to know a lot about the younger days of Angular.
About Author: He is focussed to what he wants to explain out of this course.

Pros: Someone looking to dive into some existing code in Angular 1.4,, this is course is a quick brush up.
Cons: Missed few things like Dependency Injection, In Integration with APIs,, which are mostly the real world scenarios.

results.content:
Maruti appears to have some knowledge, when it comes to AngularJS.  The problem is that he doesn't seem to know how to teach beyond what you would read online.  The courses started off great.  This was an introduction to AngularJS, which is exactly what I was looking for.  However, I hoped this would give you practical use for AngularJS, instead of just a list of things you can use in it.  I blame myself for not reading the course list, but that doesn't mean this isn't for everyone.

Even though this is a pretty good introduction, I can't bring myself to leave 5 stars, or even a full 4 stars.  The instructor seems to have just put together some quick lessons, in order to make a quick buck.  Here are the biggest issues:

1) He rarely goes back over topics previously discussed.  You go back to a few key concepts that are required to get the language going, but if it isn't required, he never talks about it again.
2) About half way through the course, he got lazy and just started pasting in code, instead of walking you through it as he did it.  While he does a pretty good job at going back and telling you why he did it, you don't benefit from watching him code and and hearing his thoughts on the code, as he creates it.  It would be acceptable to start with a base template that is required to get AngularJS to run, but don't paste the entire file at one time.
3) In the lesson about cookies, he doesn't even tell you where he got the URL for the file from.  I ended up searching Google APIs for it.  In a later lesson, he tells you that you can find these files on the AngularJS website.  That doesn't do anyone any good, unless they aren't doing lessons in order.
4) Lessons 21 is the same video as Lesson 10.  He didn't even try.
5) In the final (and only) quiz, the questions aren't completely clear and asks one of the questions in such a way that I don't think he even used the terminology during the course.

I'm not sure if I would recommend this lesson for anyone else.  I feel like I could have just watched this all on YouTube for free.
results.content_html:
Maruti appears to have some knowledge, when it comes to AngularJS. The problem is that he doesn't seem to know how to teach beyond what you would read online. The courses started off great. This was an introduction to AngularJS, which is exactly what I was looking for. However, I hoped this would give you practical use for AngularJS, instead of just a list of things you can use in it. I blame myself for not reading the course list, but that doesn't mean this isn't for everyone.

Even though this is a pretty good introduction, I can't bring myself to leave 5 stars, or even a full 4 stars. The instructor seems to have just put together some quick lessons, in order to make a quick buck. Here are the biggest issues:

1) He rarely goes back over topics previously discussed. You go back to a few key concepts that are required to get the language going, but if it isn't required, he never talks about it again.
2) About half way through the course, he got lazy and just started pasting in code, instead of walking you through it as he did it. While he does a pretty good job at going back and telling you why he did it, you don't benefit from watching him code and and hearing his thoughts on the code, as he creates it. It would be acceptable to start with a base template that is required to get AngularJS to run, but don't paste the entire file at one time.
3) In the lesson about cookies, he doesn't even tell you where he got the URL for the file from. I ended up searching Google APIs for it. In a later lesson, he tells you that you can find these files on the AngularJS website. That doesn't do anyone any good, unless they aren't doing lessons in order.
4) Lessons 21 is the same video as Lesson 10. He didn't even try.
5) In the final (and only) quiz, the questions aren't completely clear and asks one of the questions in such a way that I don't think he even used the terminology during the course.

I'm not sure if I would recommend this lesson for anyone else. I feel like I could have just watched this all on YouTube for free.

results.content: This is a great first step to learning AngularJS.  I've already started working with Ionic, but was looking for a structured Angular course and found this.  Note it is not comprehensive by any means, but it is very appropriate for anyone very new to it.  Understanding the material presupposes a familiarity of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.  Otherwise, it would not make a lot of sense. Thanks very much for making this available.
results.content_html: This is a great first step to learning AngularJS. I've already started working with Ionic, but was looking for a structured Angular course and found this. Note it is not comprehensive by any means, but it is very appropriate for anyone very new to it. Understanding the material presupposes a familiarity of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Otherwise, it would not make a lot of sense. Thanks very much for making this available.

results.content: Great course!  The instructor was easy to follow and he presented the concepts in a way that was easy to understand.  I will have to refer back to a few of them to make sure that I fully grasped the concepts, but I definitely feel more confident about AngularJS than when I started.
results.content_html: Great course! The instructor was easy to follow and he presented the concepts in a way that was easy to understand. I will have to refer back to a few of them to make sure that I fully grasped the concepts, but I definitely feel more confident about AngularJS than when I started.

results.content: Explains complicated issues in very simple terms. He explains something in 30 seconds that others take 5 minutes to explain the same thing. Audio quality and his accent is not the best but nothing that would keep you from understanding. I just wish that he would cover more of angular as this course only covers the very basics. I hope he comes out with more courses that are more complete. I would definitely by them.
results.content_html: Explains complicated issues in very simple terms. He explains something in 30 seconds that others take 5 minutes to explain the same thing. Audio quality and his accent is not the best but nothing that would keep you from understanding. I just wish that he would cover more of angular as this course only covers the very basics. I hope he comes out with more courses that are more complete. I would definitely by them.
